data.title: Blind Target (2000)
data.meta_description: A popular American novelist, who has written her first non-fiction work about the political infidelities and corruption within the tiny South American country of San Hermoso, returns to that very country as part of a publicity junket prepared by her publishing company. Traveling with her best friend and confidant, she is abducted by a mysterious cartel that proves to be the secret police arm of the government. In order to win her freedom and to save her friend's life, she is forced to commit a murder that would be beneficial to San Hermoso's dictator. Will she be willing to trade a life for a life and pull the trigger to murder her unknown target in cold blood? Will the C.I.A. be able to reach her in time? Will she even survive?
data.text:
The Year/s of Franco #139

Self-made Latin American novelist Maria is a hit in the States. Her latest book, a thinly veiled critique of her home country's dictatorship, has become a bestseller, and her manager unwisely launches a tour for her back home, where a horde of bitter friends and villainous agents lie in wait. After an ex-girlfriend blackmails her by having sex with her in front of a security camera for the Americans, Lina Romay and some chode with a gold earring show up to give her electric shock torture. Luckily her ex-fiancé knows some good karate moves.

Is my dispiritedness showing? Sorry. I can't write creatively about this crap. There really ought to be someone who has more…
